column4: hey everyone. is it possible to disable the local cupsd and use a remote one to print?

how would i do that? i stopped the local cupsd, and used the printing administration gui to connect to the other cups server. i can print test pages there fire. however, i cannot find an option to make the remote server be the default/show up in file->print dialogs
that still uses two cups instances, doesn't it?
i'd say so. point me to what i missed then
hmm, i've gotten cups to not use the local but remote server (using /etc/cups/client.conf) - now i just need to find out where gtkprint stores the default server
now you have direction for research. keep going
need to tell gtk-print to use lp as the backend =)
